revisions.rev:
{{Main|Commemorative coins of Poland}} Poland has a rich selection of [[Gold]] and [[Silver]] commemorative coins. In the year 2006 coins were launched in the series: "Animals of the World", "History of the Polish ZÅoty", "The Polish Calendar of Traditional Customs and Rituals", "Monuments of Material Culture in Poland" (previously "Castles and Palaces in Poland"),"History of the Polish Cavalry", "Polish Painters of the Turn of 19th and 20th Centuries" and various occasional coins.{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/Homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2006.html | title=Collector coins and 2 zÅ Nordic Gold coins issued by the NBP in 2006 | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-03}} {|class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[2006 Winter Olympics|XXth Olympic Winter Games]], [[Turin]] 2006 (gold){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2006/turyn_en.pdf | title=XXth Olympic Winter Games, Turin 2006 coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-03}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 7,000 pcs / 6,000 pcs{{Cite journal|title=Cennik monet kolekcjonerskich | journal=PrzeglÄd Numizmatyczny |publisher=Stowarzyszenie NumizmatykÃ³w Polskich - Polish Numismatic Society|volume=63/2008 |issue=4 |pages=23â26 |year=2008 |issn=1231-143X |oclc=68734851 }} | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 24 January 2006 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.50|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:'''
Q4 2008: 1.400 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: At the bottom on the left-hand side, an image of the Eagle established as the state emblem of the Republic of Poland. Above the Eagle, a stylized image of a ski jumper going down the ramp. Below on the left-hand side a semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, and the notation of the year of issue, 2006.At the top on the right-hand side an inscription, 200 ZÅ. Below against the background of a stylized jumping hill a visible inscription, [[Torino|TURYN]]/2006, or a stylized snowflake, depending on the angle of vision. Above the mark of the face value, a stylized fragment of a mountain range. The Mintâs mark under the Eagleâs left leg. Reverse: On the left-hand side, a stylized image of a ski jumper. Below, an oblique inscription, XX ZIMOWE / IGRZYSKA / OLIMPIJSKIE (20th WINTER / OLYMPIC / GAMES). On the right-hand side, a stylized image of the Olympic torch and a vertical inscription, TURYN / 2006. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[2006 Winter Olympics|XXth Olympic Winter Games]], [[Turin]] 2006 (silver) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 71,400 pcs / 71,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 24 January 2006 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:'''
Q4 2008: 55 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: An image of the Eagle established as the state emblem of the Republic of Poland.Above, a stylized image of a snowboarder. On the left-hand side, a vertical inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, and next to it, on the left-hand side, an inscription, 10/ZÅ. On the right-hand side of the Eagle, the notation of the year of issue, 2006. The Mintâs mark, m/w, under the Eagleâs left leg. Reverse: A stylized image of a snowboarder. On the left-hand side, a stylized image of the Olympic torch and a vertical inscription, [[Torino|TURYN]] / 2006. Against the background of a decorative relief stylized images of snowflakes. On the left-hand side, at the bottom, a semicircular inscription, XX ZIMOWE IGRZYSKA OLIMPIJSKIE (20th WINTER / OLYMPIC / GAMES). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[2006 Winter Olympics|XXth Olympic Winter Games]], [[Turin]] 2006 (silver) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 72,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 24 January 2006 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:'''

At the top, a semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. The Mint's mark, m/w, under the Eagle's left leg Reverse: In the central part, a stylised image of a fragment of woodcut representing the King Aleksander JagielloÅczyk (Alexander Jagiellon) sitting on a throne and the Chancellor Jan Åaski holding the Statute and a seal die. Above the throne a semicircular inscription, 500-LECIE WYDANIA STATUTU ÅASKIEGO (500th anniversary of the publication of the Statute by Åaski). On the rim, stylised images of 23 coats of arms of: state, fiefdoms and lands encompassed in the Kingdom of Poland. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''History of the [[Polish Cavalry]]:''''' The [[Piast]] Horseman (gold){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2006/piastowski_en.pdf | title=The Piast Horseman coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-08}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 10,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 22 November 2006 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.50|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:'''
Q4 2008: 1400 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: On the left, an image of the Eagle established as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland. On the right, an image of Szczerbiec (lit. notched sword), the sword that was traditionally used in the coronation ceremony of Polish kings. In the background, a motive from the sword's hilt. On the right, the notation of the year of issue: 2006. On the top right, a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA (the Republic of Poland). At the bottom, an inscription: 200 ZÅ. Under the Eagle's left leg, the mint's mark: m/w. Reverse: In the centre, a stylised image of an armoured mounted sergeant with a bared sword. In the background, the sergeant's shadow. On the left, a semicircular inscription: JEÅ¹DZIEC PIASTOWSKI (the Piast Horseman) |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''History of the Polish Cavalry:''''' The [[Piast]] Horseman (silver) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 62,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 22 November 2006 | align=center | '''Dimensions:'''

Above the eagle, on the right, a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA (the Republic of Poland) and the notation of the year of issue: 2006. Below the eagle, on the right, an inscription: 10 ZÅ, on the left, images of two spearheads on poles. Under the Eagle's left leg, the mint's mark: m/w. Reverse: In the centre, a stylised image of an armoured mounted sergeant with a bared sword. In the background, the shadow of an armoured mounted sergeant holding a spear. On the top right, a diagonal inscription: JEÅ¹DZIEC PIASTOWSKI (the Piast Horseman). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''Polish Painters of the Turn of 19th & 20th Centuries:''''' [[Aleksander Gierymski]] (1850â1901){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2006/gierymski_en.pdf | title=Aleksander Gierymski coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-08}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Roussanka Nowakowska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 20 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' 925/1000 Ag (Silver) and paints: red, yellow, green and blue | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 66,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 5 December 2006 | align=center | '''Dimensions:'''

Q4 2008: 100 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: A stylised image of fragments of Aleksander Gierymski's painting "Jewess with Lemons" of 1881. At the top, on the right side, an image of the Eagle established as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Around the Eagle, an inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, a notation of the year of issue, 2006 and an inscription, 20 zÂ¸. The Mint's mark, m/w, under the Eagle's left leg. Reverse: An effigy of Aleksander Gierymski from the painting "Self-Portrait with a Palette" of 1891-1892. On the right side, a stylised image of a fragment of the painting "Feast of Trumpets" of 1890. On the left side, a vertical inscription, ALEKSANDER/GIERYMSKI/1850-1901. In the left bottom corner, a palette and three paintbrushes. On the palette, paints: red, yellow, green and blue. |- | colspan="4" |   |} ==See also== * [[Numismatics]] * [[Regular issue coinage]] * [[Coin grading]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Polish currency and coinage}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Commemorative Coins Of Poland: 2006}} [[Category:Commemorative coins of Poland]]
